content:
Is this a Proton mail account maybe? I think this is a Proton Mail Bridge thing, not a Thunderbird thing:

https://proton.me/support/what-is-the-recovered-messages-folder-in-bridge
creator: DavidGG

content:
It seems to be a "hiccup" that Proton Bridge automatically generates. The only way to get rid of it is to delete your account from Thunderbird and re-add it.

Thanks!
creator: benjamin.kurata

content: click to the addressbook pane then, click the small icon immediately to the right of the 'new contact' button
creator: davidsk

content: that message occurs when the profiles.ini file is pointing to a profile that does not exist. that doesn't happen if you always copy the thunerbird folder, as that keeps the profiles.ini and profile in sync. my guess is you copied the profile folder. Instead, copy the thunderbird folder from appdata\roaming
creator: davidsk

content:
Your mail is provided by whom? What is the mail server named in your account settings?

This could mean you have a get what you pay for mail provider or there might be a genuine issue. Without the information on what provider it is there is no way to even try and confirm there is an issue.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: look for a file, compatibilities.ini, in the profile folder and delete it. Do this after installing 128.
creator: davidsk

content: In compose window, press the F9 key. that should display the addressbook on left side. If the menu bar is missing, pressing the Alt key should restore it.
creator: davidsk

content:
Dipende... Se usavi IMAP, tutta la posta dovrebbe essere scaricata di nuovo. Se usavi POP3 non c'è nessun automatismo, devi verificare se la posta è ancora presente sul server di Gmail quindi spostarla nuovamente in Posta in arrivo, marcarla come Non letta e solo dopo provare nuovamente a scaricarla su Thunderbird.

Se invece disponi di un backup, è possibile ripristinare tutto in una decina di minuti.
creator: @next

content:
Anzitutto riporta l'esatto messaggio di errore che ti compare. E poi il maggior numero possibile delle seguenti informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next
